contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox MP | honorific-prefix = | name = Joan Walley | honorific-suffix = [[Member of Parliament|MP]] | image = | office1 = [[Member of Parliament (UK)|Member of Parliament]] <br> for [[Stoke-on-Trent North (UK Parliament constituency)|Stoke-on-Trent North]] | parliament = | majority1 = 8,235 (20.5%) | term_start1 = 11 June 1987 | term_end1 = | predecessor1 = [[John Forrester]] | successor1 = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1949|01|23|df=yes}} | birth_place = [[Stoke-on-Trent]], [[Staffordshire]], England | death_date = | death_place = | restingplace = | birthname = | nationality = [[United Kingdom|British]] | party = [[Labour Party (UK)|Labour]] | otherparty = | spouse = | partner = | relations = | children = | residence = | alma_mater = | occupation = | profession = | signature = | website = [http://www.joanwalleymp.org.uk joanwalleymp.org.uk] }} '''Joan Lorraine Walley''' (born 23 January 1949) is a [[United Kingdom|British]] [[Labour Party (UK)|Labour Party]] [[politician]], who has been the [[Member of Parliament]] (MP) for [[Stoke-on-Trent North (UK Parliament constituency)|Stoke-on-Trent North]] since [[United Kingdom general election, 1987|1987]]. ==Early life== She attended Biddulph Grammar School (now known as Woodhouse Middle School) on ''Woodhouse Lane'' in [[Biddulph]], north [[Staffordshire]]. At the [[University of Hull]], she gained a [[Bachelor of Arts|BA]] in Social Administration. From the [[Swansea University|University College of Wales, Swansea]], she gained a Diploma in Community Work Development. From 1970-3, she worked on an Alcoholics Recovery Project. From 1974-8, she was a Local Government Officer for [[City and County of Swansea council|Swansea City Council]]. She worked for Wandsworth Council from 1978-9. From 1979-82, she was a Development Officer for [[NACRO]]. ==Parliamentary career== Since the deselection of her predecessor [[John Forrester]] in 1987, she has been [[Labour Party (UK)|Labour Party]] [[Member of Parliament]] (MP) for [[Stoke-on-Trent North (UK Parliament constituency)|Stoke-on-Trent North]] (the second female MP for the seat after [[Harriet Slater]] from<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thisisstaffordshire.co.uk/portvale/Robbie-Earle-Stoke-Vale-successes-Noughties/article-1657386-detail/article.html|title=Robbie Earle: Stoke and Vale among the successes of the 'Noughties'|last=Earle|first=Robbie|date=December 31, 2009|work=The Sentinel|accessdate=31 December 2009}}</ref> 1953 to 1966). Walley had previously been a councillor on [[Lambeth Council]]. ==Personal life== She married Jan Ostrowski in 1981 and they have two sons. Walley is a [[Port Vale F.C.|Port Vale]] supporter (Port Vale is the major club within her constituency).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thisisstaffordshire.co.uk/portvale/Port-Vale-Big-names-Vale-s-bargain-season-ticket/article-872788-detail/article.html|title=Port Vale: Big names back Vale's 'bargain' season ticket|last=Tideswell|first=Martin|date=April 4, 2009|work=The Sentinel|accessdate=2009-04-04}}</ref> ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.joanwalleymp.org.uk Joan Walley MP] official site *{{MPLinksUK | hansard = ms-joan-walley | guardian = 5367/joan-walley | publicwhip = Joan_Walley | theywork = joan_walley/stoke-on-trent_north | record = Joan-Walley/Stoke-on-Trent-North/494 | bbc = 25330.stm | journalisted = }} {{s-start}} {{s-par|uk}} {{incumbent succession box | title = [[Member of Parliament]] for [[Stoke-on-Trent North (UK Parliament constituency)|Stoke-on-Trent North]] | years = [[United Kingdom general election, 1987|1987]] | before = [[John Forrester]] | start = 1987 }} {{s-end}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Walley, Joan L | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = British politician | DATE OF BIRTH =23 January 1949 | PLACE OF BIRTH =[[Stoke-on-Trent]], [[England]], [[UK]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Walley, Joan L}} [[Category:1949 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Labour Party (UK) MPs]] [[Category:Members of the United Kingdom Parliament for English constituencies]] [[Category:Councillors in Greater London]] [[Category:British female MPs]] [[Category:People from Stoke-on-Trent]] [[Category:People from Biddulph]] [[Category:Alumni of the University of Hull]] [[Category:UK MPs 1987–1992]] [[Category:UK MPs 1992–1997]] [[Category:UK MPs 1997–2001]] [[Category:UK MPs 2001–2005]] [[Category:UK MPs 2005–2010]] [[Category:UK MPs 2010–]]
